Deskzilla 3.2.2

This version is open source and UNSUPPORTED.

Deskzilla 3.2

Support for Bugzilla 5.0

Bugzilla 5.0 is now supported.

Bundled with Java 8

Deskzilla is fully compatible with Java 8 and can utilize the latest improvements.

Deskzilla 3.1

Support for Bugzilla 4.2

Bugzilla 4.2 is now supported, including local bug IDs in the See Also field.

Toggle full screen on Mac OS X Lion

You can now view Deskzilla in the full screen on Lion using Tools | Toggle Full Screen.

Deskzilla 3.0

Support for Bugzilla 4.0

Bugzilla 4.0 is now supported, including the new default workflow.

See the list of bugs you have recently changed

Deskzilla now shows the most recently uploaded bug, either new or updated, in the status bar. Just click on that message or press Ctrl+/ to see all your recent uploads. Now it's easy to find the bug that you have just submitted.

Per-query table configuration

Bug table settings, including selected columns, sorting, and hierarchy setting, are now remembered independently for each query.

Search for empty fields

Is empty option has been added to the Query Builder, so you can easily find bugs that have certain fields empty.

Combine and save text searches

A new type of search condition is Text Search. Text Search conditions work just like Quick Search, but you can use them to make complex, persistent queries.

More control over synchronization

Use Right Click | Get Changes in Background submenu to suppress background synchronization for rarely used connections.
You can use Right Click | Reload JIRA Configuration command on individual connections to save time and network traffic when downloading server-side configuration changes.

Deskzilla 2.1

Bug flags

Add flag columns to the bug table using Ctrl + ] or clicking "..." button in the top right corner of the table. You can view flags of an individual bug in the bug details view.
Edit flags in New Bug and Edit Bug dialogs or right from the table using Right Click | Edit Flags.
Search for flags using Search | New Query using simple conditions on Flag Type, Flag Setter, or Flag Requestee. You can also specify several conditions, such as flags of specific type set by specific people using Flags condition.

Attach files and screenshots when creating bugs

Capture a screenshot, edit and attach it directly from New Bug window. To add screenshot to an existing bug, you may paste or drag-and-drop an image on it, and screenshot editor will appear. Note that you can now Undo and Redo your changes in the screenshot editor.
Similarly, it is possible to attach a file while creating an bug.

Clickable links to comments, attachments and emails

Navigate to comments, open attachments, and create emails with a single click on Bugzilla-style references in description, comments, and large text fields.

Quick as-you-type navigation

Run Search | New Query or press F3, select Reporter and focus the list on the right using Alt + Click or Ctrl + Click. Start typing any part of the reporter name, and the first matching item will be selected. Use arrows to navigate to the next or previous matched name.
Use this feature in any list to quickly locate the desired item. For example, in the last scenario you could start typing "Re" to select Reporter in the "Constraint type" list.

Recent items

After you have chosen a value in any editor, including New Bug, Edit Bug and Create Query, Deskzilla will hint you next time you open them with your last selected items.

Simplified interface

We have reworked the interface in numerous places to make it easier to use and redesigned the main menu to make it more logical.

Avoiding illegal values

New Bug and Edit Bug windows now check for illegal values and warn if you try to upload or save them.

Message panel

If Deskzilla needs to tell you something about a bug, it shows it in the new message panel found below the bug viewer. If something goes wrong, don't panic! Deskzilla will offer appropriate actions to deal with the problem.

Deskzilla 2.0

Time Tracking

Select a bug and use Right Click | Work on Bug or Ctrl + G to set it as your current task and start tracking time.
Use Time | Open Time Tracker menu item or Ctrl + M to view time tracking control window. Use Time | Edit and Publish Time to add tracked time to bugs and upload to Bugzilla.

Explore auto-pause settings, configured with Time | Time Tracking Options.

Note that if you turn on Tools | Use System Tray menu option (available on Windows and Mac OS X with Java 6), Deskzilla will show auto-pause notifications and you will also be able to quickly open time tracking control with a single click on the system tray icon.

Support for Bugzilla 3.4

Custom fields that depend on other fields are supported on Edit Bug form.

See Also field is now available on Edit Bug form. When viewing a bug with this field set, click on See Also field to open related bugs in a separate tab.

Bugs of Bug ID type are supported on Edit Bug form.

Clickable bug references

Click on references to a bug or a number of bugs in comments, description and large text fields to open them in a separate tab.

Deskzilla 1.7

Edit by Drag & Drop

Select bugs and drag them over a query or a distribution node in the Navigation Tree. If drop is possible, the target node is highlighted and a hint showing resulting changes is shown.

NB: You can bulk edit bugs by selecting them and dropping over a query.

NB: After bugs are edited with drag & drop, they are not uploaded automatically. Use Connection | Upload Changes or F6 to upload all changed bugs, and Right Click | Upload to send to server changes to a specific bug.

NB: You can also use Copy and Paste instead of Drag and Drop.

Support for Voting

You can now search by total votes, cast and change your votes and see who's voted for a bug. Use Ctrl + Alt + V or toolbar button to set/remove a vote, or Right Click | Advanced Voting to bring up voting dialog.

CC User List Improvements

You can search and create distributions with "user in CC list" filter. You can also edit CC list of a bug by using Right Click | Edit CC list.

Keywords Improvements

Keywords is now an enumerable field. You can search and make distributions by keyword and select from a list of known keywords when editing a bug.

Bug References Export/Import

To export bugs, select them and copy to clipboard. You then can paste them into any text editor as a list of bug URLs.

To import references, select a text that contains bug URLs and copy to clipboard. Then select a local tag node in the Navigation Tree, and Right Click | Paste. Before importing, a connection must be configured with the same base URL as the original connection.

Minimize to System Tray

You can turn on Tools | Use System Tray when running on Windows or Mac OS X to make Deskzilla hide to system tray when you minimize or close its main window.

Deskzilla 1.6

Screenshot Capture & Edit

Select a bug and use Right Click | Attach Screenshot to capture screenshot. Alternatively, use PrintScreen button and the paste the screenshot from clipboard on a bug.

Export to PDF

Use Export button and select PDF format. Export attributes, comments, attachments.

Highlight/Filter Bug Table

Click Ctrl + Shift + F or use Search | Find in Table menu item to open highlight/filter panel in a tab with a table of bugs.

Improved Synchronization

Deskzilla now performs quick update once every 2-3 minutes: server changes will appear in Deskzilla very quickly.

Show Selected Bugs in a Tab

Select one or more bugs and hit Alt + Enter.

View Bug in a Separate Window

Select a bug and hit Shift + Enter.

Attach with Drag-and-Drop

Drag files from operating system and drop them over bug row in a table. You can also use Copy and Paste.

Deskzilla 1.5

Private comments support

Reload all details for the selected bug (Shift + F5) to let Deskzilla see if you can see private comments and change comment privacy. Then add a comment or edit a bug and note the "Private" checkbox beside comment edit area. Private comments and description are rendered in red color. To change comment's privacy, use context menu (Right Click).

Custom fields support

Use Connection | Reload Bugzilla Configuration or Ctrl + F5 to have Deskzilla catch up with the custom fields configuration on your Bugzilla. Then you should be able to view, create and edit bugs with custom fields. You can also create queries, as well as distributions by drop-down custom field values.

Tags (formerly known as Collections)

It's now possible to create a query "bug is tagged as ABC", and also create a distribution by Tags. Check out corresponding options in Create Query (Search | New Query) and Create Distribution dialogs (Search | Create Distribution). Tags now are accompanied by icons (you can add your own). To change tags for selected bugs, use Ctrl + T or toolbar button.

Visual Reorder

Allows to rearrange bugs in arbitrary order and store this order in Bugzilla. (Requires Bugzilla 3 and a text custom field.) Run any query and then select Tools | Reorder by Field or Ctrl + R.

Deskzilla 1.4

Bugzilla groups support

Run Connection | Reload Bugzilla Configuration to download group information from Bugzilla. Now if you open "New Bug" dialog, you can select security groups for the new bug. An existing bug's groups may be edited in "Edit Bug" window (only if the bug has been fully downloaded).

Auto-assign

Copy file etc/autoAssign.xml from installation directory to workspace (also under "etc" sub-directory). Define auto-assign rules, following instructions in the file. Restart Deskzilla, select a number of bugs and use Right Click | Auto-assign action, or use special button on Edit Bug dialog.

Improved table header

On top of a bug table, look for the query name and the "path" to the query in the Navigation Tree. Try hovering mouse pointer over a path element and clicking on it.

Quick search understands bug URLs

Paste any valid Bugzilla bug URL into quick search box.
